abstract: You can knock large icons down to a more elegant size by adjusting a system setting.
snippet: You can knock large icons down to a more elegant size by adjusting a system setting.
lead_paragraph: If you find the large icons in the Windows Vista (and Windows 7) Start menu large and unwieldy, you can knock them down to a more elegant size by adjusting a system setting. Just right-click on the Windows taskbar and choose Properties from the pop-up menu. Click the Start Menu tab in the box that appears and then click on the Customize button. Scroll down until you get to the “Use large icons” line and remove the checkmark from the box. Click O.K. until all the dialog boxes are closed.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Large Icons in Windows Vista
